commits.author: julienmich@gmail.com
commits.message:
Fixed a bug in openmmintegrator where the velocities where not correctly converted from OpenMM ( nanometer per picosecond ) to Sire  ( angstrom per AKMA time). 
With no cutoff and a huge box (effectively no PBC), the kinetic and potential energies of Sire and OpenMM are identical.

commits.author: chryswoods
commits.message:
I've finished refactoring the animation code so that it now sits in Page, rather than PageView.
While doing this, I have also added in a Page parent-child hierarchy, so that pages can 
disable animations, block or pause all of their children, grandchildren etc. I've also
added in clipping, which should clean up the animations.

It all compiles and links, but the config page doesn't show! It is too late in the evening
to debug, so I will look at it tomorrow...

keep growing as they increase in size for each page...

commits.author: chryswoods
commits.message:
I've separated out the SireSim options library into a new library called "Conspire".

In this, I have put a cut-down version of Siren, so that Conspire can either compile
as a standalone project, or it can link against the larger, standard Siren library.

Code compiles, links and runs as expected, although many unit tests need to be
written to make sure that the port from Sire to Siren is correct.

commits.author: chryswoods
commits.message:
I've been debugging the code, have added in an example of what I want the LSRC simulation
config file to look like (including how I want lists to be input, and ranges, e.g.
1..10 would be 1 to 10, 20..(10)..100 would be 10 to 100, in steps of 10, 
while 1000..(1000)..-1 would be 1000 to the end of the list, in steps of 1000. All together,
these would be input as;

list = [ 1..10, 20..(10)..100, 1000..(1000)..-1 ]

In this update, I have also added some code to allow recognition of some numbers, and made
the unit recognition code more robust (e.g. if some units have spaces, e.g. kcal mol^-1).

Now code like;

l = LengthValue("5.5 thousand angstroms")

will be parsed correctly ;-)

Code compiles, links and runs as expected

I've filled in all of the code for SireSim::Option and SireSim::Options. This code handles all

Code is broken

commits.author: chryswoods
commits.message:
I've been working on the user interface to Sire. I have decided to use a series of XML files
to describe the various options available to a simulation. These describe the options,
which are represented in C++ as Option and Value objects. These can read and write themselves
to simple text files, thereby providing a friendly, high-level consistent interface to the
Sire-derived programs. In addition, the XML files make it easy for other programs to read and
write Sire config files, thereby easing the integration of Sire into other packages and
GUIs.

See share/SireSim/proteinligandmc.xml for an idea of what the XML files will look like,
though bear in mind this is still a work in progress ;-)

Code compiles, links and appears to work well. Python wrappers should not be auto-generated
for this version, as there are lots of missing functions and you will get link errors
when you try to link the resulting wrappers.

commits.author: chryswoods
commits.message:
I've added in the parameters that I want to be controlled in a ProteinLigandMC simulation.
The parameters supplied should allow an easy interface to nearly everything that can be
acheived using ProtoMS, e.g. standard MC, dual topology free energy calculations, 
absolute binding calculations, soft-core etc. The underlying ProteinLigandMC simulation class
can also return the System and Moves constructed, so an advanced user could use this
as a starting point for making more interesting types of simulation, and for beginning
their exploration of Sire.

Code compiles, links and runs as expected
